messages.message:
Is there some threshold for what UI changes to make sure to announce?

I understand the frustration with the data type UI change (since that’s a key feature we demo) and the upload UI change (since that’s a core part of the user flow), but if we change the name of an option from “custom function” to “custom cleaning function”, do you want us to announce that too?

I think it’s difficult to announce all UI changes since there may be a lot

Thanks @Serena. I think on reflection its less whats changing, and more knowing when changes will happen. If we had a Slack notification that said: "AI Hub will update in 1 hour" or something it means you'd know to go do a dry run of your demo before hopping on a customer call
But at the minute it feels very random as to whether the product will have changed or not

We do announce deployments to aihub prod in <#C04TSMWLPAS|> https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C04TSMWLPAS/p1719291286956279 (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C04TSMWLPAS/p1719291286956279), but maybe we need this announcement to be more obvious 

I think that after the deployment is complete, we should announce it in an email or <#C06FA5MBN|>, for example
I know you’re already tagged, do you have thoughts on this ^? @Ram Prasanna

As these are company wide changes, more communication is merrier and wont be considered as noise. So i'd suggest to post in <#C06FA5MBN|> along with <#C04TSMWLPAS|>. If we feel it is still not covering all then we can consider emails but would suggest to start with just the 2 slack groups
